sentences.en: And then reflect on whether additional authorities you know then would merited.
sentences.cn: 然后反思额外的权限是否是应得的.

sentences.en: He claims that their success was not merited.
sentences.cn: 他声称他们不应该获得成功。

sentences.en: He merited all the praise they gave him.
sentences.cn: 他应该受到他们的赞扬.

sentences.en: He merited all the praise which had been given to him.
sentences.cn: 他理应受到人们给他的一切称赞.

sentences.en: He merited all the praises they give him.
sentences.cn: 他们给他的所有表扬他都受之无愧.

sentences.en: His decision merited the approval of any sensible person.
sentences.cn: 他的决定应当得到所有明智人士的认同.

sentences.en: In 1996, Jiang was awarded the Silver Medal by Le Merited ET.
sentences.cn: 1996年获法国纯艺术家银质十字勋章.

sentences.en: Lowell , who succeeded him in the chair , also merited the appointment.
sentences.cn: 接替他出任这个教职的洛威尔也极其称职.

sentences.en: Raise your standards , my brave men, and set neither measure nor limit to your merited rage.
sentences.cn: 勇士们, 高举战旗,奋勇前进吧!

sentences.en: That brave deed merited a better reward.
sentences.cn: 这种勇敢的行为应该得到更好的奖赏.

sentences.en: The crime I'd committed that merited throwing me out of the neighborhood?
sentences.cn: 我犯了什么使他们要把我撵走的罪过 吗 ?

words.tran_cn: 有功绩的；有价值的；值得称赞的

phrases.tran_cn: 艺术价值；艺术水平；艺术成就
【法律】在诉讼中证明自己有理
n. （美）考绩制；文官录用制度
根据事物本身的优缺点；按照事情的是非曲直
规模指标；刻度标准；标度优值；规模效益或利益
技术水平；技术得分；技术点

trans.tran_cn: 值得，应获得( merit的过去式和过去分词 )，[宗教]（因行善而）应得（善报），应受赏（或罚），应受报答，[宗教]积德
